-User (2023-12-08): What is the best way to get rid of plastic straws? And other relevant questions regarding plastic straws.

It is not possible to recycle plastic straws. Therefore, they have to be disposed of in the regular trash. The most effective strategy to reduce environmental damage caused by plastic straws is to forego their use and opt for reusable alternatives. Additionally, plastic straws cannot be recycled due to their lightweight nature, which prevents them from being processed by recycling machinery. Chopping plastic straws into smaller pieces does not reduce their environmental impact; it is best to avoid using them altogether. Straws made from natural plant materials or corn PLA are compostable and biodegradable, unlike plastic straws, which can take up to 200 years to decompose.

-User (2023-12-08): How long does it take for a plastic straw to decompose?

Plastic straws may not degrade or disintegrate for up to 200 years.
